Articles.Content:
I run down a corridor in the alien ship

- - - Updated - - -

I fall to the ground, unconcious
(Xannari,, an update, i managed to develop a cure and am now hunting you down to save your character)
[i'm curious about this. What is it made of?]
I am now infected.

(Part of it is laced with the disease/chemical agent, the other is all cure)

(Oh, and i destroyed the alien lab that created the disease)

Yishllgg......muomatura.......Nequiens.......blohgrv......

(Falls to the floor and begins speaking gibberish)

[There's no one part of the vessel that makes the virus. It is carried by every unit]

[Plus, I meant what's the general stoichiometry? If you don't know elements, at least is it organic based?]
I crawl into a room, where I see some sort of reactor, and some scaffolding
( I wasn't here when the disease started, anyone care to tell me the page or how it started?)

[There's no one part of the vessel that makes the virus. It is carried by every unit]

[Plus, I meant what's the general stoichiometry? If you don't know elements, at least is it organic based?]

What? The cure or the Kinemet? Kinemet is a super-heavy element.
I use andromeda from 116 pages back (really?) to slam into the ship's galaxy and send my army to kill 15/18ths of the people on board.
[This "cure". Plus, isn't that going back on the "lightweight, but just as strong" thing you said earlier?]

the ship's galaxy

What?

- - - Updated - - -

[This "cure". Plus, isn't that going back on the "lightweight, but just as strong" thing you said earlier?]

The elemet itself is heavy, but it isn't very dense (about half that of water)

( I wasn't here when the disease started, anyone care to tell me the page or how it started?)

[it's a virus that delivers a mutant T-Cell to the victim, and slowly transforms their physiology with it's own genetic codings]

I am slowly being infected, but Sampa injected me with a half-dose of cure.

- - - Updated - - -

(Wakes up) Have to get to the ship, have to get to the ship.... (Begins crawling towards our ship)

(Xannari appears in front of me and injects me with an unknown substance)

I fall unconcious.

The elemet itself is heavy, but it isn't very dense (about half that of water)

[Jeez! That's 499.99 Kg/m^3! Still not as impressive as Graphene, which can be supported by blades of grass, but that's still a little ridiculous]
It floats in the lower clouds of Jool, so.....

Actually I didn't kill anyone, I just sent 100 of my soldiers to keep calm. Meanwhile I'm at the planet full of life that I claimed, trying to remote control the ship to no avail after being cryogenically frozen for 117 pages of space time and coming alive to many surprises.

(By the ship's galaxy, I meant the one it was in.)
What happened to the storyline we were on?

[There's no one part of the vessel that makes the virus. It is carried by every unit]

[Plus, I meant what's the general stoichiometry? If you don't know elements, at least is it organic based?]

(It's mostly organic in nature, with a few chemicals to increase the speed on which it reacts)

It floats in the lower clouds of Jool, so.....

[That is because Jool's atmosphere is hydrogen]

Sampa..... Help me..... It's Xannari.....

- - - Updated - - -

[That it because Jool's atmosphere is hydrogen]

But the lower clouds contain heavier elements (Why do you think it's green?)

(It's mostly organic in nature, with a few chemicals to increase the speed on which it reacts)

[Efficient design. That should land at most 3 uses, and least of 1]
Realism is overrated.

But the lower clouds contain heavier elements (Why do you think it's green?)

[Argon, to be exact. Gravity has it all accumulate lower than all that hydrononsense]
